intro: Tulipa montana var. maculata, commonly known as the spotted tulip, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It features striking, showy flowers with distinctive purple or red spots on a white or pale pink background. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 18 inches and produces sturdy, grass-like foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period is usually in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to gardens.
